intro: Lisianthius longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its long, narrow leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in the summer months. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
